newsitem.title: USA: General Growth acquires shopping mall.
newsitem.headline: General Growth acquires shopping mall.

text.p: General Growth Properties Inc said it acquired Market Place Mall and the Market Place Convenience Center in Champaign, Ill. for about $70 million.
The properties are expected to produce about $6.4 million of net operating income during the next 12 months, General Growth said.
It said the center is 88 percent occupied and generates sales of more than $250 per square foot. General Growth acquired the property from Champaign Venture, an Illinois general partnership.
This represents General Growth's first acquisition in 1997, but it has acquired ownership interests in 53 regional malls since becoming a publicly traded real estate investment trust in April 1993.
